newsitem.title: DUBAI: Qatar al-Rayyan oilfield averages 32,000 bpd.
newsitem.headline: Qatar al-Rayyan oilfield averages 32,000 bpd.

text.p: Crude output at Qatar's new offshore al-Rayyan field is averaging 32,000 barrels per day (bpd), industry sources in the Gulf said on Tuesday.
"We are producing in a prudent manner below capacity...to gather as much information on the reservoir," one industry executive said.
The first al-Rayyan export cargo was exported in late November, followed by a second cargo late last month. A third cargo of around 500,000 barrels will leave in January.
Al-Rayyan, an offshore field 156 km (100 miles) north of the Qatari capital Doha, is being developed by a foreign consortium under a production-sharing agreement with the Qatar government.

Operator ARCO Qatar Inc, a division of Atlantic Richfield Co (ARCO), has a 27.5 percent stake in the consortium with Gulf Stream Resources Canada Ltd (27.5 percent), British Gas Plc (25 percent) and German firms Wintershall (15 percent) and Preussag Energies (five percent).
Development plans for al-Rayyan include output of 50,000 bpd within four years.
